title: Commemorating the 100th Anniversary of the Church of the Sacred Heart and St. Mary Our Lady of Czestochowa
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE RESOLUTION commemorating the 100th Anniversary of the Church
of  the  Sacred  Heart and St. Mary Our Lady of Czestochowa, to be cele-
brated on Sunday, September 26, 2010

WHEREAS, Religious institutions, and  the  many  spiritual,  social  and
educational  benefits  they confer, play a vital role in the development
of the moral fabric of a responsible citizenry; and
  WHEREAS, It is the tradition of this State  and  this  Nation  to  pay
tribute  to  those  institutions and individuals who have contributed to
the ethical and spiritual values of their communities; and
  WHEREAS, This Legislative Body takes  pleasure  in  commemorating  the
100th  Anniversary  of  the  Church of the Sacred Heart and St. Mary Our
Lady of Czestochowa, to be celebrated on Sunday, September 26, 2010; and
  WHEREAS, In the years 1908 and 1909, St. Mary's Parish was a temporary
Mission of Holy Trinity Parish in Utica, New York;  it  was  established
for  the  Catholic  people  of the Village of New York Mills and for all
Catholics of Polish descent from the  surrounding  vicinity;  originally
there were about 200 families in the Parish; and
  WHEREAS,  In  1910,  the Church was designated as a Parish by the Most
Reverend Patrick Ludden, Bishop of  Syracuse  and  administered  to  the
Priests  of Holy Trinity Parish; Reverend Stephen Plaza was appointed as
the first resident Pastor; and
  WHEREAS, On July 1, 1994, Father Valentine C. Krul, became  pastor  of
St.  Mary's,  his  home  parish;  he  was  baptized,  received his First
Penance, First Communion and Confirmation at St Mary's; he also  arrived
the day St. Mary's school closed which was a very difficult time for the
parish  and  their  new  pastor,  but  The Holy Spirit prevailed and the
people continued on in the love of Christ; and
  WHEREAS, When Father Krul arrived at St.  Mary's,  he  consulted  with
Mrs.   Linda DePhillips, who was then the Director of St. John the Evan-
gelist Nursery School in New Hartford; they discussed as  to  whether  a
nursery  school  would  be feasible at St. Mary's and the conclusion was
that St.  Mary's Nursery School would open in September 1994  under  the
direction  of  Mrs.  Linda DePhillips; the school began with 21 students
and two teachers; and
  WHEREAS, Since September of 2008, the school has  become  a  full-time
program  with  an all day nursery school program offered for children 18
months to four years of age; currently, the afterschool program  is  for
children ages five through twelve; and
  WHEREAS,  On  September  9,  2007,  a  Unity  Celebration was held, to
acknowledge the past and welcome the future of two parishes;  the  cele-
bration began at Sacred Heart Church with a Mass followed by a motorcade
which  proceeded  to the new Church of the Sacred Heart & St.  Mary, Our
Lady of Czestochowa, where music welcomed the procession with songs such
as "City of God"; the motorcade was escorted by the New York  Mills  and
Yorkville Police and Fire Departments; and
  WHEREAS, When the procession arrived at the parish Church the Mayor of
New  York  Mills,  Robert Maciol, welcomed the newly formed community to
New York Mills; the tabernacle, sanctuary lamp, statues  of  the  Sacred
Heart, Our Lady Queen of Victory and the crucifix from Sacred Heart were
enshrined in their new church building; the celebration of the Eucharist
continued  and  Father  Valentine Krul now serves as pastor of the newly
formed parish- Church of the Sacred Heart & St. Mary, Our Lady of  Czes-
tochowa; and
  WHEREAS,  Over  the years, the Church of the Sacred Heart and St. Mary
Our Lady of Czestochowa has offered numerous programs and activities  in
addition to its worship services; and

  WHEREAS, The Church of the Sacred Heart and St. Mary Our Lady of Czes-
tochowa  stands on the threshold of tomorrow, prepared to meet the chal-
lenges of the coming decades  while  retaining  that  spiritual  resolve
which characterizes its past; and
  WHEREAS,  It  is  the custom of this Legislative Body, to take note of
enduring religious institutions and to bring such  institutions  to  the
attention of the people of this Empire State; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
commemorate the 100th Anniversary of the Church of the Sacred Heart  and
St.  Mary  Our  Lady  of  Czestochowa, fully confident that this commem-
oration reflects the belief in those values which  enhance  the  dignity
and purpose of life; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to the Church of the Sacred Heart and St. Mary Our Lady of Czes-
tochowa.
